intro: Ceropegia pullaiahiana, commonly known as the Kanyakumari ceropegia, is a flowering plant native to the southern regions of India. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its trailing stems and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its leaves are opposite and often have a velvety texture, while the flowers are usually pale green or white. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
